title: What are some words to describe nature? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are three basic meanings: nature - substance or physical or other essence or makeup (not to be conflated with cosmetics), qualities, attributes It was not in her nature to speak rudely or out of turn.What is the nature (the essence) of this document? Is it also marked “Top Secret”?nature - (usually “out in ~”) the great outdoors, pastoral (non-urban) places, aka “Mother Nature” I like water sports and camping mostly because I enjoy breathing the sweet oxygen-rich clean air out in nature, and getting some good exercise.nature - the “stuff of life” and all organisms/organic beings, plants and how they live and operate (a sort of catch-all for biology, God, life force or divine or spiritual providence) Strict Bible believers think that homosexuality goes against our fundamentally-human nature.The context determines appropriate usage.

Image source - my camera phone gallery (shot on Asus Zenphone) Nature cannot be fully described and expressed in words . Only a little of it can be expressed in poetic language and imagination . To better understand nature one should spend time in nature. Every person view and observe things differently. It can be wild for someone and at same time it can be a comfortable home for someone. It can be beautiful at one time and it can be cruel , brutal and scary on the other . Nature don't have any boundaries and limitations( our language, culture and traditions have). Nature is quit old and at the same time as young as first orgasmic pleasure. Nature is beyond. Nature holds the answers to all the questions and at the same time it's a deep deep mystery. Feel free to explore nature and please save it. Upvote if you got some hint as I cannot describe it too. Thanks  Edit - 1 Attaching some photographs I clicked as a nature lover .  ………….  ……………  THANKS. Upvote if you like. I will upload more.
